title: Delta flight makes emergency landing due to loss in cabin pressure - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Delta flight makes emergency landing due to loss in cabin pressure Published on : Friday, August 21, 2015
An issue with the cabin pressure forced a Delta Air Lines flight to make an emergency landing at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport on Thursday.
Federal Aviation Administration revealed that the Delta flight 1665, an Airbus A320 was scheduled to fly from D/FW to Salt Lake City. There were 150 passengers and 5 crew members on board the flight. The flight returned to the airport at 4:14 p.m.
According to the reports made by NBC 5, a woman on board was heard saying that the crew members told the passengers that the flight lost cabin pressure and there will be an emergency landing.
According to the updates, the flight was originally diverted to Amarillo, but due to the loss in cabin pressure the pilot decided to return to the D/FW airport instead. The plane is under a maintenance team, examining and evaluating the technical issue involved.
As per the statements made by a Delta spokesperson, there were no injuries and no customer concerns and reaffirmed Deltaâ€™s commitment to ensure the safety of the passengers and the crew members.
